content:
NamedPermissionSet Class

In this Article

Defines a permission set that has a name and description associated with it. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public sealed class NamedPermissionSet : System.Security.PermissionSet

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Security.PermissionSet
  • NamedPermissionSet

Inherited Members

,

,

Remarks

Named permission sets are used in security policy administration to specify the permissions to be granted to code that belongs to certain code groups. Names are strings of alphanumeric characters. Description strings can consist of any printable characters.

Constructors summary

NamedPermissionSet(NamedPermissionSet)

Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class from another named permission set.
NamedPermissionSet(String)

Initializes a new, empty instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name.
NamedPermissionSet(String,PermissionState)

Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name in either an unrestricted or a fully restricted state.
NamedPermissionSet(String,PermissionSet)

Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name from a permission set.

Properties summary

Description

Gets or sets the text description of the current named permission set.
Name

Gets or sets the name of the current named permission set.

Methods summary

Copy()

Creates a permission set copy from a named permission set.
Copy(String)

Creates a copy of the named permission set with a different name but the same permissions.
Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified NamedPermissionSet object is equal to the current NamedPermissionSet.
FromXml(SecurityElement)

Reconstructs a named permission set with a specified state from an XML encoding.
GetHashCode()

Gets a hash code for the NamedPermissionSet object that is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
ToXml()

Creates an XML element description of the named permission set.

Constructors

  • NamedPermissionSet(NamedPermissionSet)

    Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class from another named permission set.

    public NamedPermissionSet (System.Security.NamedPermissionSet permSet);

    Parameters

    • permSet
      NamedPermissionSet

      The named permission set from which to create the new instance.

  • NamedPermissionSet(String)

    Initializes a new, empty instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name.

    public NamedPermissionSet (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name for the new named permission set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The name parameter is null or is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    Using this constructor creates a named permission set with no permissions but with an PermissionState permission state. A named permission set in an unrestricted state effectively contains all permissions that implement the IUnrestrictedPermission interface. The named permission set will contain all built-in permissions as well as all custom user-defined permissions that implement IUnrestrictedPermission. All permissions will have the equivalent of an Unrestricted permission state. Permissions that do not implement IUnrestrictedPermission will be empty instances.

  • NamedPermissionSet(String,PermissionState)

    Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name in either an unrestricted or a fully restricted state.

    public NamedPermissionSet (string name, System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name for the new named permission set.

    • state
      PermissionState

      One of the PermissionState values.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The name parameter is null or is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    A named permission set in an unrestricted state effectively contains all permissions that implement the IUnrestrictedPermission interface. The named permission set will contain all built-in permissions as well as all custom permissions. All permissions will have an UnrestrictedPermissionState. Permissions that do not implement IUnrestrictedPermission, such as identity permissions, will be empty instances.

  • NamedPermissionSet(String,PermissionSet)

    Initializes a new instance of the NamedPermissionSet class with the specified name from a permission set.

    public NamedPermissionSet (string name, System.Security.PermissionSet permSet);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name for the named permission set.

    • permSet
      System.Security.PermissionSet

      The permission set from which to take the value of the new named permission set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The name parameter is null or is an empty string ("").

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the NamedPermissionSet constructor to create a new NamedPermissionSet object. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

Properties

  • Description

    Gets or sets the text description of the current named permission set.

    public string Description { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A text description of the named permission set.

    Remarks

    The description helps the administrator understand in words what permissions the set contains and its intended use.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Description property to display the description of the current NamedPermissionSet. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

  • Name

    Gets or sets the name of the current named permission set.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the named permission set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The name is null or is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    Code groups refer to permission sets by name.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Name property to display the name of a NamedPermissionSet. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

Methods

  • Copy()

    Creates a permission set copy from a named permission set.

    public override System.Security.PermissionSet Copy ();

    Returns

    • System.Security.PermissionSet

      A permission set that is a copy of the permissions in the named permission set.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Copy method to create a copy of the current NamedPermissionSet. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

  • Copy(String)

    Creates a copy of the named permission set with a different name but the same permissions.

    public System.Security.NamedPermissionSet Copy (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name for the new named permission set.

    Returns

    • NamedPermissionSet

      A copy of the named permission set with the new name.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The name parameter is null or is an empty string ("").

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether the specified NamedPermissionSet object is equal to the current NamedPermissionSet.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The NamedPermissionSet object to compare with the current NamedPermissionSet.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified NamedPermissionSet is equal to the current NamedPermissionSet object; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For more information, see Equals.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Equals method to compare two NamedPermissionSet objects. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

  • FromXml(SecurityElement)

    Reconstructs a named permission set with a specified state from an XML encoding.

    public override void FromXml (System.Security.SecurityElement et);

    Parameters

    • et
      SecurityElement

      A security element containing the XML representation of the named permission set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The et parameter is not a valid representation of a named permission set.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The et parameter is null.

    Remarks

    This method recreates the state of a named permission set from an XML element previously created by ToXml.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the FromXml method to recreate a NamedPermissionSet object. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.

  • GetHashCode()

    Gets a hash code for the NamedPermissionSet object that is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for the current NamedPermissionSet object.

    Remarks

    The hash code for two instances of the same permission might differ, hence a hash code should not be used to compare two NamedPermissionSet objects.

  • ToXml()

    Creates an XML element description of the named permission set.

    public override System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml ();

    Returns

    • SecurityElement

      The XML representation of the named permission set.

    Remarks

    Use FromXml to recreate the state represented by the returned element.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the ToXml method to recreate a NamedPermissionSet object. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NamedPermissionSet class.
